medical_history.chief_complaint: Headaches and a 6-week history of intermittent, transient vision loss.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Headaches developed 21 months before the current presentation, generally located in the right temporal area, characterized as throbbing, lasting approximately 5 to 10 minutes. During the 6 weeks before this presentation, sporadic episodes of transient vision loss occurred, lasting 5 to 10 seconds, with dizziness and pulsatile tinnitus. Headaches worsened with changes in position.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) suspected, along with a previous diagnosis of leukocytoclastic vasculitis and exacerbations of cutaneous vasculitis with glucocorticoid treatment. History of glucocorticoid-related weight gain and osteoporosis.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had coronary artery disease, father had valvular heart disease, and maternal grandmother had a stroke. Sisters were healthy, with no family history of neurologic, ophthalmologic, or rheumatologic disease.
medical_history.social_history: Previous work in the restaurant business but had to discontinue due to physical limitations. Had an 8.5-pack-year smoking history and continued to smoke several cigarettes daily. Did not consume alcohol or use illicit drugs.
